page.title: 12THE VILLAGE CHURCH
page.content: THE CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1865. AT PRESENT 8 PEOPLE ATTEND THE 8 AM SERVICE AND 25 THE MAIN 11 AM SERVICE. THERE ARE 700 PEOPLE IN THE VILLAGE. THE CHURCH IS RUN BY THE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCIL. WEST BUTTERWICK SHARES THE VICAR WITH OWSTON FERRY WHERE HE LIVES.THERE IS NO CHURCH SUNDAY SCHOOL.VOLUNTEERS CLEAN THE CHURCH AND BRING IN FLOWERS .MR FROST HAS BEEN THE ORGANIST FOR 25 YEARS.THERE ARE A LOT OF FUNERALS AND CHRISTENINGS AND A FEW WEDDINGS .THIS YEAR THE CHURCH IS BEING RENOVATED AND DECORATED BY THE MANPOWER SERVICE COMMISSION AT NO COST TO THE VILLAGE .IT IS 25 YEARS SINCE IT WAS LAST DONE THEY HAVE FAMILY SERVICES AT CHRISTMAS AND THE MAIN FESTIVALS . PEOPLE CAN BE BURIED FREE IN THE CHURCHYARD.
